conclusion: A falls freely from above. Determine where it will eventually collide with those blocks and land. Provide reasoning based on gravity, collision, and deflection effects observed in the scene.
A is positioned above several blocks of different sizes.

premise: A is falling freely from above.
conclusion: A will follow the path of least resistance, which is directly downward due to gravity.

premise: A is falling directly downward due to gravity.
conclusion: The block directly below A is the closest object in its path, so A will collide with it first.

premise: A collides with the block directly below it.
conclusion: A will likely come to rest on top of the block due to the force of the impact and the stability of the block.

premise: A collides with the block directly below it.
conclusion: The other blocks surrounding the one directly below A are not in its direct path, so they will not be affected by the collision.

premise: A collides with the block directly below it.
conclusion: A first collides with the block closest to him, and then, under the influence of the block, bounces away the adjacent block above it.

premise: A bounces away the adjacent block above it.
conclusion: Then A fell onto the adjacent lower square under the action of the square.
